title: Course for Improving Mathematical Thinking and Academic Achievement Through Motivation Regulation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and practical application experience
context.additional_context: Customized design emphasizing job relevance for current practitioners, providing motivation and feedback through real-time interaction

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain over 80% of cognitive learning strategies needed to solve complex mathematical problems using motivation regulation strategies (MRSs).
By establishing and executing a learning plan applying MRSs, learners can improve mathematics achievement (based on assessment scores) by 20% compared to baseline.
Through peer feedback, learners can analyze MRSs application cases and derive three or more strategies applicable to real-world tasks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
